definition: to borrow sth for another use/to borrow an idea for one's own use
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: There are the metaphor phenomena by diet in Chinese ancient literature and art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 艺术批评中普遍存在着喜好借用饮食譬喻的现象。

sentences.english: In a fine irony, the red shirts have now borrowed many of the PAD’s tactics.
sentences.chinese: 更具讽刺的是，红衫军现在借用了许多民盟的策略。

sentences.english: Can I borrow the wuye dog, he thought, for uncertain.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，可以借用五爷的狗来为莫测治病。

sentences.english: Then, he borrowed the idea of a seven-day week and leap year from the Hebrew calendar.
sentences.chinese: 接着，他借用了希伯来历法中一周七天和闰年的概念。

sentences.english: Go and ask the neighbours if we can borrow their hammer.
sentences.chinese: 去问邻居们借用一下他们的榔头。

sentences.english: You are welcome to the loan of my knife.
sentences.chinese: 你可随意借用我的小刀。

sentences.english: As an example of such useless lands, the court referred to a prior case involving a salt marsh.
sentences.chinese: 为了举出废地的例子，法院借用了以前盐沼地案。

sentences.english: Then can I borrow your tennis racket, since
sentences.chinese: 既然您不用网球拍，那我可以借用一下吗？

sentences.english: If you want to download any pictures, please inform the webmaster. Thank you!
sentences.chinese: 如欲借用本网任何图文，请先联络网主，多谢合作。

sentences.english: Both of you are great light borrowers.
sentences.chinese: 你俩都是光的伟大借用者。

sentences.english: To borrow an expression from the younger generation here, the Japanese people seem to have completely transformed their kyara (character).
sentences.chinese: 借用这里的年轻一代的表达，日本人像转了性一样。

sentences.english: May I borrow your knee pads and elbow pads?
sentences.chinese: 我可以借用一下你的护膝和护肘吗？

sentences.english: I need to borrow your computer.
sentences.chinese: 我需要借用一下你的电脑。

sentences.english: Conditional word can borrow some walkie-talkie.
sentences.chinese: 有条件的话能够借用一些对讲机。

sentences.english: To borrow an expression of Lenin’s, we were useful idiots.
sentences.chinese: 借用列宁的话说，我们不过是“有用的白痴”。

sentences.english: It is too closely related to mathematics not to have borrowed their gratuitousness.
sentences.chinese: 它非常接近数学，你无法从中借用它们的无效性。

definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
to draw support from/with the help of
to copy a set pattern mechanically/to crib
to utilize/to put sth to use
so as to/for the purpose of/in order to
to replace/to take the place of
to exploit/to make use of/to use/to take advantage of/to utilize
